Bardot was the venue for our "proper Catalan dinner" - meaning a series of substantial courses beyond your usual pintxos or tapas.  Upon entering, you are welcomed by a very long bar that had stretches and stretches of stools that could easily make patrons happy - especially those who came by to watch the World Cup while enjoying their drinks. Dinner was out of this world with some of the most inventive food that capitalized on local ingredients.  We had several starters including these delectable squid that was filled with black rice, melt-in-your-mouth croquettes, and fried goose egg with plenty of truffles on top (that was simply accompanied by slices of crusty bread for dunking)!  But the piece de resistance was the bone-in steak that was served sizzling on an iron skillet.  Forget mashed potatoes or mac and cheese, the only side dish this steak needed were the freshest slices of tomatoes and cubes of perfectly seasoned cubes of potatoes.  And for dessert, you ask?  The simplest yet most divine crepes that were filled with sugar, honey, and butter.  I may truly have to change my last meal on earth menu to this one!
